About City
LOCALLY OWNED & OPERATED!
A BIT ABOUT US:
City Tavern is a locally owned happy hour & nightlife hot spot that is sure to please! With a relaxed, comfortable atmosphere, friendliest staff, and daily specials, there is something for everyone at City Tavern. City Tavern has received awards for “Friendliest Staff”, “Best Happy Hour” and “Best Girls Night Out.”
A BRIEF HISTORY:
We are in the heart of the Downtown Fort Myers River District, adjacent to the Luminary Hotel & Co. at the corner of Bay & Dean Streets. City Tavern is in The Dean Building, which has roots dated back to 1914 when John Morgan Dean built the structure around two existing 19th-century homes. The original hotel that Dean built was called The Morgan Hotel.
City Tavern has been in business since 1998 and has been under the same local ownership since 2008. While working closely with the River District Alliance, neighboring businesses, and the City of Ft. Myers, City Tavern is one of many downtown destination spots in the Fort Myers River District. We welcome everyone to come enjoy a little piece of Lee County history, that is, Downtown Fort Myers! Cheers!
LOCALLY OWNED & OPERATED!
A BIT ABOUT US:
City Tavern is a locally owned happy hour and night life hot spot that is sure to please! With a relaxed, comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff members, and daily specials, there is something for everyone at City Tavern. City Tavern has received awards for, “Friendliest Staff”, “Best Happy Hour” and “Best Girls Night Out.”
Our completely renovated kitchen now offers a fresh new food menu daily, 11AM-10PM! City Tavern teamed up with celebrity Chef Brian Duffy to bring some of the newest, freshest ideas in gastropub fare to hit Southwest Florida.
A BRIEF HISTORY:
We are located in the heart of the Downtown Fort Myers River District, adjacent to the Harborside Convention Center on the Caloosahatchee River. Situated in The Dean Building, City Tavern rests on the corner of Bay & Dean Streets. The Dean Building’s roots go back to 1914 when John Morgan Dean built the structure around two existing homes built in the 1800’s.
Downtown Ft. Myers has seen many changes over the years, to say the least. Downtown underwent extreme changes including a totally new streetscape, which was completed in 2009. The latest River District changes include a brand new riverfront basin located directly in front of City Tavern, which was completed in late 2012. The construction of The Luminary Hotel began in 2018 and is scheduled to be completed in the Fall of 2020
City Tavern has been under the same local ownership since August, 2008. While working closely with the River District Alliance, neighboring businesses, and City of Ft. Myers officials, City Tavern is one of many Downtown destination spots in the Fort Myers River District. We welcome everyone to come enjoy a little piece of Lee County history that is, Downtown Ft. Myers!
